Description: Cylinder jar of marl pottery coated with a beige-grey slip and well burnished. Narrows slightly from the base to the neck, where there is an irregular incised line and an impress rope design. It has an everted roll-rim. Part of the rim has been repaired.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Type as E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), pl. XXXIII, 70. Like Wavy handled W71a or W80 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Bears excavator's mark: H.T.(not in publication) on base.
